thread.title: Manchester United fans trolled the bizarre formation v Leicester
thread.title_full: Manchester United fans trolled the bizarre formation v Leicester

title: Manchester United fans trolled the bizarre formation v Leicester
text:
Man United fans joked about the bizarre formation v Leicester By Benjamin Newman on Sunday, February 5, 2017 Did Jose Mourinho wind back the clock? 
The 2016-17 Premier League season has been dominated by one formation. 
Adopted by Antonio Conte in the 3-0 defeat away at Arsenal at the start of the campaign, three at the back is now the in thing when it comes to innovative tactics in the EPL. 
Not only do Chelsea do it, but so do Tottenham, West Brom and West Ham, to name but a few. 
But when Man United lined up against Leicester on Sunday at the King Power Stadium, Jose Mourinhoâ€™s tactics felt like a time warp. Back to basics? 
With Wayne Rooney out the team with illness, Mourinho played a 4-4-2 against Leicester. 
That involved having Henrikh Mkhitaryan down one flank and Juan Mata down the other, with Paul Pogba and Ander Herrera in the centre. 
Was it a coincidence the match started at such a terrible pace? 
After 20 plus minutes of the Match, Mourinho scrapped his odd tactical choice. 
In fairness to the Special One, once he reverted to a 4-5-1 formation Man United closed the half with two goals.
